intro: Behenantha multifida, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Indian mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Indian subcontinent. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forests and along stream banks. Its leaves are edible and have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
